newsitem.title: USA: Unicom, AlliedSignal in generator alliance.
newsitem.headline: Unicom, AlliedSignal in generator alliance.

text.p: Unicom Corp, parent of utility Commonwealth Edison, said Tuesday it will begin selling small power generators to commercial and industrial customers as part of a long-term alliance with AlliedSignal Inc.

Unicom said it will buy an undisclosed number of natural gas-fired TurboGenerators from AlliedSignal. Unicom has the exclusive right to sell them to industrial and commercial customers in 10 Midwestern states and Ontario, Canada.
The on-site generators will allow customers to produce their own power, cutting consumption during peak demand.
The TurboGenerator agreement is part of Unicom's strategy to offer services to industrial and commercial customers in the face of deregulation of the U.S. electricity industry.
Under deregulation, large users will be able to obtain electricity from the open market.

"With TurboGenerator technology in our product portfolio, Unicom will now be able to target niche energy marktes, including distributed generation, standby power, off-grid power generation, portable power, uninterruptible power supplies and cogeneration," William Downey, Unicom's vice president for customer operations, said in a statement.
The power generators will be offered not only to customers of Chicago-based Commonwealth Edison, but to industrial and commercial users throughout the Midwest and in Ontario.
"Bear in mind our relationship is broader" than Commonwealth Edison's service area, Christopher Mahoney, general manager of Unicom Resources Inc, said in a telephone interview.

The generators will be marketed to small commercial businesses, institutions, light industry and organizations. AlliedSignal said the generators are lightweight, compact units that are low in cost and almost emission-free.
For AlliedSignal, the multi-year agreement with Unicom is the first of what it hopes will be four exclusive agreements with utilities across the United States.

"Our strategy is to develop parallel relationships in three other regions in the U.S. with utility partners...that have the stature of Unicom," Tony Prophet, president of AlliedSignal Power Systems Inc, a unit of AlliedSignal, said.
AlliedSignal also plans to market the TurboGenerator globally, such as in China and India.
Prophet added that the alliance with Unicom likely will lead to other power-generation technology, including other sizes of TurboGenerators and cogeneration modules.
